ygData.subject: Re: attn: john kim (jig Vs mana regen)
ygData.msgSnippet: ... From the Concert Hall Message Board http://www.sitepowerup.com/mb/view.asp?Action=Reply&BoardID=105220&Reply=7792 re: It DOES NOT increase mana regen. by
ygData.messageBody:
>From: <kim@...>
>I agree with the other comment, you should probably be
>meditating while testing this. Also, immediately after the
>test you should cast a spell that takes a known amount of mana
>in bubbles, to see if there is any phantom mana effect that's
>making it appear as if you have more mana than you do.
>
>--
>John H. Kim
>kim@...

From the Concert Hall Message Board
http://www.sitepowerup.com/mb/view.asp?Action=Reply&BoardID=105220&Reply=7792

re: It DOES NOT increase mana regen.
by Rogiere posted 10/13/99 6:07:44 AM

I tested it with a lvl 50 wizard and a clock.. we used ice comet and what
ever to dump his mana to zero twice. I started the timer and sang jig o
vigor with MM Battle drums no less, then repeated with him jsut sitting and
meding.. and i tell you.. lvl 50.. full mana regen.. omg we took a full hour
just doing this... anyhow.. both times were within 10 sec... so.. this is
prolly just error on our part in not being perfectly exact.. but 10.. at lvl
50.. that is no diff at all.. its a total shamm

**********************************************************************
Rokenn Swiftsong - Karana server
Master Craftsmen of Societus Argenti
